@description.name: @description
@description.body: The Core module's responsibility is to query the DOM for elements and offer these elements as a collection. The Core module itself does not offer any methods to work with the collection. These methods are added by the other included modules, such as Manipulating or Attributes. Core also provides the plugin API which allows modules to attach either static functions to the global q object or define methods on the collection it returns. By default, the core module is assigned to a global module named q. In case q is already defined, the name qxWeb is used instead. For further details, take a look at the documentation in the user manual.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
arg {var} An array of Elements which will
   be initialized as {@link q}. All items in the array which are not
   either a window object, a DOM element node or a DOM document node will
   be ignored.
@param.description:
An array of Elements which will
   be initialized as {@link q}. All items in the array which are not
   either a window object, a DOM element node or a DOM document node will
   be ignored.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: clazz {Class} The class of the new collection.
@param.description: The class of the new collection.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This is an API for module development and can be used to attach new methods to {@link q}.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: module {Map} A map containing the methods to attach.
@param.description: A map containing the methods to attach.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: override {Boolean?false} Force to override
@param.description: Force to override

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This is an API for module development and can be used to attach new methods to {@link q}.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: module {Map} A map containing the methods to attach.
@param.description: A map containing the methods to attach.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: override {Boolean?false} Force to override
@param.description: Force to override

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This is an API for module development and can be used to attach new methods to {@link q} during runtime according to the following conventions: Public members of the module are attached to the collection similar to qxWeb.$attach. Members beginning with '$' or '' are ignored. Statics of the module are attached to {@link q} similar to qxWeb.$attachStatic. Statics beginning with '$' or '', as well as constants (all upper case) and some qooxdoo-internal statics of the module are ignored. If more fine-grained control outside if these conventions is needed, simply use qxWeb.$attach or qxWeb$attachStatic.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: clazz {Object} the qooxdoo class definition calling this method.
@param.description: the qooxdoo class definition calling this method.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: staticsNamespace {String?undefined} Specifies the namespace under which statics are attached to {@link q}.
@param.description: Specifies the namespace under which statics are attached to {@link q}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This is an API for module development and can be used to attach new initialization methods to {@link q} which will be called when a new collection is created.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: init {Function} The initialization method for a module.
@param.description: The initialization method for a module.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Define a new class using the qooxdoo class system.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
name {String?} Name of the class. If null, the class will not be
   attached to a namespace.
@param.description:
Name of the class. If null, the class will not be
   attached to a namespace.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
config {Map ? null} Class definition structure. The configuration map has the following keys:
NameTypeDescription
extendClassThe super class the current class inherits from.
constructFunctionThe constructor of the class.
staticsMapMap of static values / functions of the class.
membersMapMap of instance members of the class.
deferFunctionFunction that is called at the end of processing the class declaration.
Important hint: Please do not initialize reference types (Object or Array) directly inside the members section. Only list and initialize it with null. Initialize your reference type inside the construct. Check out one of the samples below to get the idea.
@param.description:
Class definition structure. The configuration map has the following keys:
NameTypeDescription
extendClassThe super class the current class inherits from.
constructFunctionThe constructor of the class.
staticsMapMap of static values / functions of the class.
membersMapMap of instance members of the class.
deferFunctionFunction that is called at the end of processing the class declaration.
Important hint: Please do not initialize reference types (Object or Array) directly inside the members section. Only list and initialize it with null. Initialize your reference type inside the construct. Check out one of the samples below to get the idea.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Primary usage: Accepts a selector string and returns a collection of found items. The optional context element can be used to reduce the amount of found elements to children of the context element. If the context object is a collection, its first item is used. Secondary usage: Creates a collection from an existing DOM element, document node or window object (or an Array containing any such objects) Sizzle is used as selector engine. Check out the documentation for more details.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
selector {String|Element|Document|Window|Array} Valid selector (CSS3 + extensions),
   window object, DOM element/document or Array of DOM Elements.
@param.description:
Valid selector (CSS3 + extensions),
   window object, DOM element/document or Array of DOM Elements.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: context {Element|q} Only the children of this element are considered.
@param.description: Only the children of this element are considered.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets a new collection containing only those elements that passed the given filter. This can be either a selector expression or a filter function.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: selector {String|Function} Selector expression or filter function
@param.description: Selector expression or filter function

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {q} New collection containing the elements that passed the filter
@return.description: New collection containing the elements that passed the filter

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Recreates a collection which is free of all duplicate elements from the original.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {q} Returns a copy with no duplicates
@return.description: Returns a copy with no duplicates

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns a copy of the collection within the given range.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: begin {Number} The index to begin.
@param.description: The index to begin.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: end {Number?} The index to end.
@param.description: The index to end.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {q} A new collection containing a slice of the original collection.
@return.description: A new collection containing a slice of the original collection.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Removes the given number of items and returns the removed items as a new collection. This method can also add items. Take a look at the documentation of MDN for more details.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: index {Number} The index to begin.
@param.description: The index to begin.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: howMany {Number} the amount of items to remove.
@param.description: the amount of items to remove.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: varargs {var} As many items as you want to add.
@param.description: As many items as you want to add.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {q} A new collection containing the removed items.
@return.description: A new collection containing the removed items.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns a new collection containing the modified elements. For more details, check out the MDN documentation.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: callback {Function} Function which produces the new element.
@param.description: Function which produces the new element.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: thisarg {var} Context of the callback.
@param.description: Context of the callback.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {q} New collection containing the elements that passed the filter
@return.description: New collection containing the elements that passed the filter

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns a copy of the collection including the given elements.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: varargs {var} As many items as you want to add.
@param.description: As many items as you want to add.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {q} A new collection containing all items.
@return.description: A new collection containing all items.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the index of the given element within the current collection or -1 if the element is not in the collection

@param.name: @param
@param.body: elem {Element|Element[]|qxWeb} Element or collection of elements
@param.description: Element or collection of elements

@param.name: @param
@param.body: fromIndex {Integer} The index to start the search at
@param.description: The index to start the search at

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Calls the browser's native debugger to easily allow debugging within chained calls. Unlike the logThis method this implementation blocks the further processing.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Logs information about the current collection, its DOM elements and the length. Very useful during development to easily check the current state of your collection and avoid common pitfalls like an empty collection. Unlike the debug method this implementation works non-blocking.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Calls a function for each DOM element or document fragment in the collection. This is used for DOM manipulations which can't be applied to document nodes or window objects.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
func {Function} Callback function. Will be called with three arguments:
 The element, the element's index within the collection and the collection itself.
@param.description:
Callback function. Will be called with three arguments:
 The element, the element's index within the collection and the collection itself.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: ctx {Object} The context for the callback function (default: The collection)
@param.description: The context for the callback function (default: The collection)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Calls a function for each DOM element node in the collection. Each node is wrapped in a collection before the function is called.

@param.name: @param
@param.description:
Callback function. Will be called with three arguments:
 The element wrappend in a collection, the element's index within the collection and
 the collection itself.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: ctx {Object} The context for the callback function (default: The collection)
@param.description: The context for the callback function (default: The collection)
